creator: kevinj@develop.com
text:
I have a security-role-ref with a role-name and role-link. The role-link refers 
to security-role (the values match). I also have a security-constraint, with an 
auth-constraint with the role-name from the security-role. Standard 
authentication works fine - I can log in as the role defined in the security-
role, however if I try and call isUserInRole on the role-name in the security-
role-ref element, it always returns false.

My reading of the spec (pfd page 76) is that isUserInRole should return true 
for a role-ref that refers to a security-role that is authenticated (phew!)

creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
Yup, it's broken.  I just fixed the implementation of isUserInRole() so that it 
correctly respects aliases defined with a <security-role-ref> element.  This 
will show up in tonight's nightly build (and in beta 2).
